df-relexp
blocks.content: Definition of repeated composition of a relation with itself, aka relation exponentiation. (Contributed by Drahflow, 12-Nov-2015.) (Revised by RP, 22-May-2020.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-relexp(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(crelexp, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, cn0, cif(cres(cid, cun(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cfv(cseq(nat1, cmpo(s2, s3, universe, universe, ccom(cv(s2), cv(s0))), cmpt(s4, universe, cv(s0))), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s1), nat0))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
}

axiom df-relexp(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  âŠ¢ ^r =(s0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, s1 âˆˆ â„•0 â†¦ if(s1 = 0,(= |`(dom(s0)â‹ƒ ran(s0))),(seq(1((s2 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, s3 âˆˆ ğ•Œ â†¦(s2 âˆ˜ s0)),(s4 âˆˆ ğ•Œ â†¦ s0)))` s1)))
  âŠ£ d(s0, s1)
  âŠ£ d(s1, s2)
  âŠ£ d(s1, s3)
  âŠ£ d(s1, s4)
  âŠ£ d(s0, s2)
  âŠ£ d(s0, s3)
  âŠ£ d(s0, s4)
  âŠ£ d(s2, s3)
  âŠ£ d(s2, s4)
  âŠ£ d(s3, s4)
}

blocks.name: relexp0g

blocks.name: dfid5
blocks.content: Identity relation is equal to relational exponentiation to the first power. (Contributed by RP, 9-Jun-2020.)

blocks.name: dfid6
blocks.content: Identity relation expressed as indexed union of relational powers. (Contributed by RP, 9-Jun-2020.)

thm dfid6(setvar s0, setvar s1) {

  dfid4(s0)

  syl5eq(ciun(s1, csn(nat1), co(cv(s0), crelexp, cv(s1))), cv(s0), co(cv(s0), crelexp, nat1), wcel(cv(s0), universe))
  iunxsn(s1, nat1, co(cv(s0), crelexp, cv(s1)), co(cv(s0), crelexp, nat1))
  1ex()
  oveq2(cv(s1), nat1, cv(s0), crelexp)

}

  oveq2d(c0, crelexp, c2, nat0, w3a(wceq(c2, nat0), wrel(c0), wcel(c0, c1)))
  syl2anc(w3a(wceq(c2, nat0), wrel(c0), wcel(c0, c1)), wceq(co(c0, crelexp, nat0), cres(cid, cuni(cuni(c0)))), wcel(c0, c1), wrel(c0))

blocks.name: relexpcnvd
blocks.content: Commutation of converse and relation exponentiation. (Contributed by Drahflow, 12-Nov-2015.) (Revised by RP, 30-May-2020.)

blocks.name: relexp0rel
blocks.content: The exponentiation of a class to zero is a relation. (Contributed by RP, 23-May-2020.)

blocks.name: relexprelg
blocks.content: The exponentiation of a class is a relation except when the exponent is one and the class is not a relation. (Contributed by RP, 23-May-2020.)

  neneqd(c0, nat1, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(c1, c2)))

  eluz2b3(c0)
  relexprelg(c0, c1, c2)
}
